page.title: 12THIRD HOUSE FARM
page.content: Third House Farm is near Ashington and can be aproached by the Ashington to Woodhorn or the Woodhorn to Linton road. The farm is aproximately 300 acres in size and has many animals including Danish Blue cows, poultry, bullocks but most of the farm is used for agrigultural purposes. Buildings on the farm include a silage clamp, a covered cattle shed, open pens, chicken coops, an empty wooden building, some cottages and a farm house. The farm house was built about the turn of the 20th century out of stone. The farm cottages were built before the Second World War and were also built of stone. The purpose of the covered cattle shed is to house the cattle and store food. The farm land is mainly land reclaimed from the N.C.B spoilheaps which increased it's area. The N.C.B still owns the farm
